subject: Education
subcategory: Great Teachers Who Changed the World
title: John Dewey: Democracy Starts in School
description: A quick, practical guide to John Dewey: Democracy Starts in School.

hook.text: Dewey said democracy isn't just a political system ‚Äî it's a way of living. And school is where children learn to live

buildup.text: At his Laboratory School in Chicago, students learned by solving real community problems, not by memorizing textbooks.

discovery.text: Dewey believed education must connect to real life. A child building a toy boat learns physics, math, and cooperation.

twist.text: His progressive education movement was distorted by followers who dropped rigor for freedom. Dewey himself criticized

climax.text: Dewey's core insight endures: school should prepare citizens for democracy, not just workers for the economy.

punchline.text: If school doesn't teach democracy, where will children learn it? Dewey asked

quiz.question: What did Dewey believe was the primary purpose of education?
options: Preparing citizens for democratic life through real experience
